reviews.text: This station is such a lovely station! There is ALWAYS someone really helpful available to help you with the ticket machines, check that you know where you’re going, and so forth.  There is a great selection of eateries and coffee places. The toilets are clean and well cared for. Even the Virgin helpers on tne platform are helpful and cheerful! Well done all involved!
What a great station. The staff here are so welcoming and happy to help. Station is kept clean and tidy. There is a Costa Coffee and newsagents on platform 2 and a small shop at the entrance.

My Wife and I were going to Manchester to see the Motown musical,it was a very bad day weather wise and part of the track was flooded,got from Chester to here and a employee came on to the train to tell us this,he was quite abrupt really and when people asked him questions it was like he wasn't bothered,we eventually got some info to walk to another station in Warrington which we were told was a 15 minutes walk,I was walking with a stick and it took us and more able bodied people over 30 minutes,we had not got a clue where we were going,just staff pointing the way the station was,it was chucking it down with rain too,got to Manchester only to sit in a theatre with wet clothes,I know the railways can't do much about flooding but I thought it was disgusting how we were treated!
A great station in a great place can go to liverpool and manchester or even london and glasgow and you also have central round the corner so what more could you want.
The station where the trains are taking you on the WCML, all the way to London or Glasgow. Also, Manchester Airport or Manchester Piccadilly. Enjoy!
